es.uam.eps.padsof.emailconnection

Class EmailSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.uam.eps.padsof.emailconnection.EmailSystem

  • public class EmailSystem
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EmailSystem() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean isValidEmailAddr(java.lang.String emailStr)
      This methods checks whether or not the given string parameter meets the syntax requirements for email addresses established by the RFC822: Standard for ARPA Internet Text Messages
      static void send(java.lang.String emailStr, java.lang.String subject, java.lang.String body)
      This method sends an email message after successfully checking the Internet connection and the validity of the destination email address, and no trace is printed.
      static void send(java.lang.String emailStr, java.lang.String subject, java.lang.String body, boolean trace)
      This method sends an email message after successfully checking the Internet connection and the validity of the destination email address, and prints a trace if its last parameter is set to true.

    • Method Detail

      • isValidEmailAddr

        public static boolean isValidEmailAddr(java.lang.String emailStr)
        This methods checks whether or not the given string parameter meets the syntax requirements for email addresses established by the RFC822: Standard for ARPA Internet Text Messages
        Parameters:
        emailStr - The string email address to be checked for valid syntax
        Returns:
        True if the given email address is valid, or false otherwise.

      • send

        public static void send(java.lang.String emailStr,
                        java.lang.String subject,
                        java.lang.String body,
                        boolean trace)
                 throws InvalidEmailAddressException,
                        FailedInternetConnectionException
        This method sends an email message after successfully checking the Internet connection and the validity of the destination email address, and prints a trace if its last parameter is set to true. To facilitate testing exceptions, FailedInternetConnectionException is thrown when the subject starts with w or W the FailedInternetConnectionException
        Parameters:
        emailStr - The string email address to use as destination of the email
        subject - The string text to use as Subject field of the email message
        body - The string text to include as body of the email message
        trace - It true, the method prints a one-line brief trace of the email sent
        Throws:
        InvalidEmailAddressException - when the given string email has an invalid format
        FailedInternetConnectionException - when Internet connection is not active when send is invoked

      • send

        public static void send(java.lang.String emailStr,
                        java.lang.String subject,
                        java.lang.String body)
                 throws InvalidEmailAddressException,
                        FailedInternetConnectionException
        This method sends an email message after successfully checking the Internet connection and the validity of the destination email address, and no trace is printed.
        Parameters:
        emailStr - The string email address to use as destination of the email
        subject - The string text to use as Subject field of the email message
        body - The string text to include as body of the email message
        Throws:
        InvalidEmailAddressException - when the given string email has an invalid format
        FailedInternetConnectionException - when Internet connection is not active when send is invoked
